title: World Records Set for Asian Artists at Hong Kong Auctions
text:
Yoshitomo Nara - Knife Behind Back (in galleries Courtesy of Sotheby's

Text size

New world records were successively set for Asian artists at auctions in Hong Kong last weekend, confirming the city’s rising status as a global art market.

On the evening of Oct. 5, Chinese-French artist Sanyu’s 1965 painting Nu fetched HK$198 million (US$25.2 million) at Sotheby’s sale of modern art. The price smashed the artist’s previous record, when his painting Five Nudes sold for HK$128 million in 2011 at Ravenel Auction Hong Kong.

Measuring approximately 48-by-53 inches, Nu was one of Sanyu’s largest nude paintings. Saturday’s sale, offered from a private collection, marked the first time the large painting appeared on the market in more than half a century.
description: Sanyu’s last masterpiece, “Nu,” and Yoshitomo Nara’s “Knife Behind Back” eachfetched over US$25 million
